intro: Dalea cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas' Dalea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its bipinnate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Dalea cuatrecasasii plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to soil stability in its native habitat.
